metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5645 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
In Apache Log4j 2.x before 2.8.2, when using the TCP socket server or UDPsocket server to receive serialized log events from another application, aspecially crafted binary payload can be sent that, when deserialized, canexecute arbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5645` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblog4j2-java - 2.10.0-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache-log4j2 package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.10.0-2').
